content: 1 in cc 2 in mc and 3 in cc from left to right the right leaning cable is similar except that an additional step is needed between b and c while the left leaning cable can easily be done with cable needles for the right leaning cable i strongly advice markers step between b and c let us call it bc rearranges stitches already on markers pull the front marker here pink and place it behind to the left of the marker here blue holding the mc purl stitch from left to right stitches are now in the sequence 2 1 3 now continue as in photo c photo 4 a b c put the stitch 1 in cc to put the stitch 2 in mc knit the stitch 3 in cc the marker and leave it in to the marker and leave put the stitch 2 back to the left front it behind needle and purl it put the stitch 1 back to the left needle and knit it 10 alternatively you can always rearrange stitches in advance be careful the mc purl should stay behind the first knit is always the stitch 3 the second is always purled the stitch 2 however it should stay behind the stitch 1 the last is knit the stitch 1 actually the cable is made across stitches 1 and 3 in the left or right leaning manner the middle stitch always stays behind crossed stitches when i got used to this type of cables i started to rearrange them without cable needles it is not complicated but one should know the philosophy of the cable first otherwise blips can occur 11
